Post¶

class oct.Post¶

Bases: object

A post-processing object for managing pipeline of OCT processing after acquisition

Notes

The post processing object will not run without a populated “data” object. This data object holds all the fringe and metadata required reconstruct the different contrasts.

self. processFrameRange is the key method in this object. This method controls all the processing that is to occur based on the options set in the “data” object.

states (ie. processStates, writeStates, holdStates, projectionStates) describe which type of frames to process, write, hold and project for a given frame range

options (ie. processOptions) signify variations of processing options designated from the “data” object

Methods

__init__()

Initialize self.

characterizeSystemBG(data)

Calculate input polarization specific BG using inter-aline median

characterizeSystemPS(data)

Calculate correction matrices for PS processing

computeMaskFrame(data)

Computes a mask for the present frame using the uint8 version of the struct, dop, and ret frames.

computeWeightFrame(data)

Computes a weight frame for the present frame using the uint8 version of the struct, dop, and ret frames.

convertFrameCircularCartesian(data)

Converts all frames to cartesian coordinates for endoscopic, rotational data :param data: Support and raw data object :type data: object

getFileInformation(data)

Get filename and file length info :param data: Support and raw data object :type data: object

holdFrameOnMemory()

Manages what frames to hold if data is to be used in a notebook.

initialize(data[, procState, writeState])

Initialization handler the tomo+struct+angio portion of the reconstruction with desired setting

initializeHSV(data[, thetaRef, hueCCW, …])

Initialize the HSV frame settings .

maskFrame(data[, mask])

Creates a mask frame for PS data frames :param data: Support and raw data object :type data: object

oopAverageStokes(data)

Manage out of plane averaging of stokes vectors if OOP requested .

processFrameRange(data[, startFrame, …])

Processes a desired frame range for a “data” object pointing to a specific directory.

projectFrame(projections, data)

Manages the creation of inline projections :param projections: projection storage and appending object :type projections: obj :param data: data holder object :type data: obj

reconstructFrame(data)

Manage which computations to perform.

setProjectionStates()

Manages which projections will be performed.

setState()

Set the reconstruction state for automated reconstruction of frame range based on the procState string

unifyImageWidths(data)

Downsample frame widths that are larger than PS frames.

writeFrame(writer, data)

Manages the execution of image appending to specific files :param data: Support and raw data object :type data: object :param writer: writer object :type writer: object

writeMetaData(data, writer)

Dispatch meta data writer prior to reconstruction images :param data: Support and raw data object :type data: object :param writer: writer object :type writer: object

writeProjection(writer, projections, data)

Manages writing of projections.
